author: Zee Media Bureau
title: 10 Shiva Temples You Must-Visit Once
text: A site where Kannappa was ready to offer his eyes to Lord Shiva, built by Rajendra Chola I in the 11th century. An ancient structure that's part of the twelve Jyotirlingas, inspired by the shape of the Sahyadri Mountain. Home to the second-highest statue of Lord Shiva, offering picturesque views of the Arabian Sea. An exquisite example of Kalinga architecture, built in red stone by King Yayati I. Reflects the Chola Dynasty's architecture, showcasing Lord Shiva as the master of dance. Renowned for its gold-plated domes and the iconic Nandi Bull statue, it's part of the 12 Jyotirlingas dedicated to Lord Shiva. A grand structure along the Shipra river, known for its artistic sculptures and five-level architecture. A magnificent temple with intricate carvings and designs, located on a historic site mentioned in Kalidasa's poems. Famous for the ice stalagmite Shivalinga, this cave temple represents the eternal powers of Lord Shiva This is the highest Shiva temple in India, part of the Char Dham pilgrimage circuit, established by Adi Shankaracharya in the 8th century

author: Kauê Alberguini
title: ‘Tribunal do crime’: PCC enterra vivos membros da própria facção em SP
text:
Criminosos foram enterrados vivos pelo PCC (Primeiro Comando da Capital) em Jundiaí, interior de São Paulo. Eles seriam integrantes da facção e teriam sido submetidos a uma espécie de “tribunal do crime”, após matarem o irmão de um membro.
Nas covas foram encontrados os quatro corpos dos assassinados pelo “tribunal do crime”. Segundo os laudos do IML (Instituto Médico Legal), obtidos pelo Metrópoles, três das vítimas foram enterradas ainda vivas.
Os cadáveres estavam com as mãos e pés amarrados, todos sem unhas, indicando a tortura antes da morte.
Os criminosos teriam matado o irmão de um integrante da facção para ficar com mais dinheiro na divisão de um montante em um assalto realizado.
Segundo um documento do MPSP (Ministério Público de São Paulo), as vítimas teriam aceitado ir para o Morro São Camilo, em Jundiaí, para resolver a situação.
A ideia era que o caso fosse resolvido através da conversa. No local, eles foram “julgados” e sentenciados a morte no “tribunal do crime”, por ordem do líder regional da facção.
Como o caso foi descoberto
O caso foi descoberto após uma vistoria do DAE (Departamento de Água e Esgoto) de Jundiaí. Um funcionário identificou um corpo enterrado no bairro Engordadouro. O Corpo de Bombeiros e a Polícia Civil foram acionados e encontraram duas covas rasas no local.
Sobrevivente do tribunal do PCC
Um dos participantes do roubo que motivou os assassinatos prestou depoimento à polícia. Identificado como Humberto, ele passou as informações para os investigadores em troca de proteção, temendo ser morto na cadeia.
Entre os assassinos, estariam Tiago Cajaíba Roberto, o Jagunço, um dos líderes do tribunal do crime; e Roberto de Oliveira Santos, o Zulu, que teria participado da chacina para pagar uma dívida com o tráfico de drogas.
Jagunço foi morto com mais de 30 tiros antes de ser encontrado pela polícia. Ele estava junto de sua esposa, que segurava um bebê de colo no momento do assassinato. O crime ocorreu em 23 de julho de 2019, seis dias antes dos corpos enterrados vivos terem sido encontrados.
Nenhum suspeito pela chacina e ocultação dos cadáveres foi preso.

author: Faith Fernandez
title: Assumption First Graders Bring Snowmen to Life with Vibrant Mixed-Media Art - Pasadena Schools
text:
[Read Previous Post](https://www.pasadenanow.com/pasadenaschools/westridge-upper-school-english-hosts-inspiring-guest-speakers-on-literature-art-and-drama/)
Assumption First Graders Bring Snowmen to Life with Vibrant Mixed-Media Art
This week in Art, first-grade students at Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary School, began an exciting creative journey using the tissue paper painting technique to design vibrant and colorful backgrounds. The young artists also tapped into their imaginations to sketch whimsical snowmen, which will soon take center stage against these vibrant backdrops. The process has been a delightful blend of exploration and creativity, and the class eagerly looks forward to the next step. In the coming week, students will peel away the tissue paper to reveal the beautiful watercolor effects beneath, bringing an added layer of texture and vibrancy to their mixed-media masterpieces. This hands-on project is sparking joy and artistic expression, creating an atmosphere of anticipation and wonder in the art studio!
Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary School, 2660 E. Orange Grove Blvd., Pasadena, (626) 793-2089 or visit [school.abvmpasadena.org](http://school.abvmpasadena.org/).

author: Oberösterreichische Nachrichten
title: Historische Kältewelle in Argentinien: 9 Tote | Nachrichten.at
text:
Historische Kältewelle in Argentinien: 9 Tote
BUENOS AIRES. In Argentinien sind während einer Kältewelle mit Minusgraden nach Angaben einer Hilfsorganisation neun Menschen ums Leben gekommen.
Laut dem nationalen Wetterdienst sank das Thermometer am Mittwoch (Ortszeit) bei Sonnenaufgang in der Hauptstadt Buenos Aires auf minus 1,9 Grad Celsius, dies war der niedrigste Wert seit 34 Jahren. Proyecto 7, eine auf die Unterstützung von Obdachlosen spezialisierte Organisation, meldete neun Tote unter Klienten.
- Lesen Sie auch:
Fähre mit über 60 Menschen vor Bali gesunken
In den vergangenen zehn Tagen starben demnach landesweit neun obdachlose Menschen an den Folgen der Kälte. Diese Zahl wurde von den Behörden nicht bestätigt. Die Kältewelle hat sich seit Anfang der Woche verstärkt. Im 25 Kilometer von Buenos Aires entfernten El Palomar wurden minus 7,4 Grad gemessen, ein Rekord seit 58 Jahren und die zweitniedrigste Temperatur seit 1935. Atlantikstrände - etwa der Strand von Miramar 450 Kilometer von Buenos Aires entfernt - waren Anfang der Woche mit Schnee bedeckt. Das ist in den vergangenen zwölf Jahren nicht mehr vorgekommen.
Die niedrigsten Temperaturen wurden in der kleinen patagonischen Ortschaft Maquinchao gemessen. Hier lagen die Temperaturen seit Montag zwischen minus zwölf und minus 18 Grad. Der Rekord von minus 35 Grad aus dem Jahr 1991 wurde jedoch nicht erreicht.

author: Carry Lifte
title: Ferrari's SF-25 Revolution: Unleashing True Potential at Japanese Grand Prix - Shocking Simulator Breakthrough - M Sports
text:
Ferrari Unleashes Game-Changing SF-25 Breakthrough Ahead of Japanese Grand Prix
In a jaw-dropping turn of events, Ferrari has made a groundbreaking discovery that is set to revolutionize their performance on the track this weekend at the Japanese Grand Prix. After a series of 20 intense simulator experiments, the Italian racing team is confident that the true potential of their SF-25 car will finally be unleashed, leaving their competitors trembling in the wake of their newfound power.
The Scuderia’s journey to this pivotal moment has been marred by setbacks and disappointments, with both Lewis Hamilton and Charles Leclerc facing disqualifications in recent races. However, with this latest breakthrough, Ferrari is poised to reclaim their dominance and establish themselves as a force to be reckoned with in the F1 2025 season.
Reports suggest that Ferrari’s meticulous attention to detail and relentless pursuit of perfection have led them to identify a solution to their setup issues, paving the way for a resurgence in form. The team’s decision to revert to a pullrod front suspension layout for the first time in a decade with the SF-25 is just one example of their commitment to pushing the boundaries of innovation in the sport.
As Ferrari prepares to take on the challenges of the Japanese Grand Prix, all eyes will be on how their new setup adjustments will impact their performance on the track. With the team confident that they have addressed the core issues hampering their progress, expectations are running high for a stellar showing in Suzuka.
Looking ahead, Ferrari’s strategic upgrades in Bahrain and Miami are set to further solidify their position as frontrunners in the championship battle. By focusing on key areas of the car’s design, such as the ‘coke bottle’ region and the base of the diffuser, Ferrari is demonstrating their unwavering commitment to staying ahead of the competition.
With Lewis Hamilton showcasing glimpses of Ferrari’s true potential in recent races, including a commanding victory in the Chinese Grand Prix sprint, the stage is set for a thrilling showdown in Japan. As the team prepares to unleash their revamped SF-25 car on the iconic Suzuka circuit, fans can expect nothing short of a spectacle as Ferrari aims to reclaim their spot at the top of the podium.
